IV. Darius is urged by his friends to prepare a fleet. With an army of 210,000 men (miles) he approaches Marathon, after the citizens of Eretria have been removed and sent into Asia (abl. absol.). As quickly as possible the Athenians send a mes- senger to Sparta. If they take the field themselves at the very first opportunity, and do not despair of the brave1·y of the citizenS, the enemy will be inore cautious and the citizens will take fresh courage.
